report.title: Valium Log
report.author: Murple
report.bodytext: Pill Description /n ---------------- /n 8mm round powder-blue pill. One side, stylized R. Other side, scored. /n Above score, '053'. Purported to be diazepam. Owing to the blue color, I /n guess that it is probably 10mg, as this is the color scheme that /n non-generic Valium uses. [Erowid Note : According to the Drug Identification Bible, this is a generic 10mg diazepam pill produced by Purepac Pharmaceutical] /n /n 1:50AM /n ------ /n I ingest the pill. We had a snowstorm today, and I had ingested some DPT /n earlier in the evening to go play in the foot deep snow (the first real /n snowstorm in over 3 years), but it has long since worn off. I also smoked /n a little pot earlier, but it has mostly worn off as well. I am more or /n less at baseline. /n /n 2:20AM /n ------ /n I begin to feel a little different. It's been a long time since I've had /n any benzodiazepines, but this does feel like what I remember. The main /n distinctions between the various benzodiazepines are in duration and /n intensity. Qualitatively they are all more or less the same. As far as /n comparison to other depressants, it is most similar to GHB, but definitely /n not the same. It's even less similar to alcohol, and only vaguely similar /n to the narcotics. I will base most of my comparisons on GHB, that being /n the depressant I'm most familiar with. Diazepam is supposed to take about /n an hour to reach peak effect, so it's still too early to really describe /n it, or compare it to anything else. Initially, it seems as if there is /n more of a calming effect, but less of a euphoric effect than GHB. The /n physical sensations are somewhat different as well. There is more of a /n feeling of muscle relaxation than GHB produces, and the ecstasy-like /n tactile enhancements of GHB are pretty much absent from the diazepam /n experience. The come-on is alot more gradual. I'm at T+0:30 now, and its /n just beginning to take effect. I'll give it some more time. /n /n 2:50AM /n ------ /n Well, I'm now at T+1:00, and I'm feeling the diazepam pretty well... tho /n from what I've read, it can take from 1-2 hours for peak plasma levels. /n And I didn't have an empty stomach, so I'm sure I haven't reached the peak /n effect yet. I can feel it gradually increasing still, in fact. I'm a good /n deal more intoxicated than I was a half hour ago, but alot of my original /n assessments hold. Compared to GHB, this is a milder intoxication, in some /n ways. The muscle relaxation is alot stronger than with GHB. The sensation /n is similar to having just stepped out of a hot bath or sauna - totally /n relaxed muscles, a jello-like body feeling. There is much more of an urge /n to close the eyes than I get on GHB, though I don't feel sleepy at all. /n As I said earlier, this is much more of a calming, relaxing feel than the /n euphoric high of GHB. There is a touch of the strobe-like dizzy visual /n effect that I sometimes get from high doses of GHB, but it is much more /n subdued. I am listening to music through headphones... diazepam seems much /n more conducive to music appreciation than GHB. I keep getting drawn to lie /n down and just relax and absorb the music. /n /n 3:10AM /n ------ /n I'm at T+1:20 now. I think I've hit the peak effects. Diazepam seems to be /n more of a dumbing high than GHB... I find myself closing my eyes and just /n listening to music and and feeling the physical sensations, there is alot /n less noise in my mind than usual. Less thoughts flying back and forth. /n This is much more noticable than on GHB. I am feel as if sleep would be /n easy and pleasant at this point, but its not the irresistable passing out /n that GHB can cause. Putting on some more uptempo music dramatically /n increases my energy level, and vanquishes all thoughts of sleep. I feel /n very mellow and relaxed. I have a pleasant body high which is similar to /n GHB, yet distinct. More relaxed, less tingly. When I get up to walk /n around, I stagger a little... unlike alcohol and GHB though, this stagger /n doesn't seem to be due to dizziness or a loss of equilibrium, but rather /n due to the fact that my leg muscles are very relaxed, and my legs feel a /n little jello-like, sort of like if I had excersized them a great deal /n earlier. My whole body in fact is sort of slumped and very relaxed. None /n of my muscles seem to have any tension. /n /n 3:25AM /n ------ /n Still about the same place, but I feel myself yawning a little now. Not /n really tired at all though. I decide to smoke some marijuana at 3:35, or /n T+1:45. /n /n 3:35AM /n ------ /n I went outside and filled a juice glass full of loose snow. I spooned this /n snow into my bong, and loaded a hit into the bowl. I take a hit... the icy /n cold condensed smoke goes down smoothly and expands in my lungs. /n Immediately I feel a significant boost in the effects of the diazepam... /n though it has changed slightly from the THC now in my system. Considering /n the date and realizing that this snow storm is probably my last /n opportunity to take snow-bongs at least until next winter, I load another /n hit and suck it down. I cough pretty hard... Well, one more just for good /n luck! I feel pretty high now... I'll give it a few minutes to settle in, /n then describe it. /n /n 3:50AM /n ------ /n T+2:00 and feelin' groovy! I predominantly feel diazepam, but its now /n strongly colored by the pot. The mild shaky visual effect I noticed /n earlier is now noticably stronger, approaching the levels I'd expect from /n alcohol... I *feel* much more lucid than I would on GHB or alcohol... But /n this is illusion. I'm clear headed, but *too* clear headed. There are far /n fewer verbal thoughts running through my mind than normal. But there is no /n feeling of confusion or disorientation. It is not a loss of coherence, /n just a drastic slowing of pace. /n /n 4:20AM /n ------ /n I take a puff, of course... I still feel about the same, and I think this /n report can be wound up now. It's T+2:30. Thinking about the diazepam and /n how the night has gone, it looks like its two primary actions seem to be /n as an anxiolytic and a muscle relaxer. There is a mild euphoria, but alot /n less than from GHB or alcohol - its more a feeling of relaxation than /n anything else. Granted I am alone right now, but this still feels much /n less of a social drug than GHB or alcohol, too - this is something I'd /n like to take by myself and lay in a hammock or on the beach. Not a party /n drug. I've enjoyed benzodiazepines every time I've done them, and find /n them far superior to alcohol. They're not something I enjoy enough to /n seek them out, but they're a nice treat when they come into my hands. I'm /n sure I will sleep well tonight!
